items.title: Some Kansas Republicans Resist Redistricting Efforts Amid Growing Skepticism
items.summary: The state’s top Republicans wanted to join President Trump’s push to redraw congressional maps. But plans for a special session fell apart when some lawmakers resisted.

items.title: How the Heavy-Metal Fall of a Dictator Shapes Trump’s Venezuela Policy
items.summary: Seizing Panama’s leader was relatively easy. But the similarities between Panama and Venezuela are dangerously misleading, some analysts warn.

items.title: Judge Rejects Utah’s Republican-Drawn Redistricting Map
items.summary: The judge instead adopted a map drawn by a centrist coalition. Democrats celebrated the ruling ahead of the 2026 midterms, but Republicans vowed to fight it.

items.title: Police Chase Driver Across Southern California Until She Escapes Into Mexico
items.summary: The woman stole a minivan, police said, beginning a dramatic pursuit that spanned four counties and reached speeds of 90 miles per hour.

items.title: The NYC Demographic Trends That Shaped Mamdani’s Win
items.summary: Moderate Black voters and young progressives favored Zohran Mamdani for mayor, while Andrew Cuomo won many wealthy New Yorkers and those who voted for Donald Trump.

items.title: Dismantled by DOGE, a Foreign Policy Center Finds New Life
items.summary: The Kennan Institute, which researches Russia and the surrounding region, has re-emerged in a form that is smaller but more impervious to government control.

items.title: Trump calls Senate bill to end shutdown a ‘very big victory’ as deal splits Democrats – US politics live
items.summary: <p>US president congratulates Republicans on deal now moving to House; Democrats riven over some senators’ support for bill</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/11/shutdown-legislation-house-democrats">Top House Democrats vow to oppose shutdown bill over healthcare funding</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ng-interactive/2025/nov/11/how-your-senators-voted-on-the-shutdown-ending-budget-bill">How US senators voted on the shutdown-ending budget bill</a></p></li></ul><p>As the supreme court deliberates on the fate of Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs – which he maintains are a matter of “national security” as justices appeared skeptical during oral arguments on the case last week –&nbsp;the president said that the US would be forced to hand “in excess of three trillion dollars” if the levies are scrapped, in a late night post on Truth Social.</p><p>He added:</p><p>It would not be possible to ever make up for that kind of a ‘drubbing.’ That would truly become an insurmountable National Security Event, and devastating to the future of our Country – Possibly non-sustainable!</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/11/donald-trump-us-government-shutdown-senate-democrats-republicans-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Search for West Virginia miner trapped by floodwater extends into fourth day
items.summary: <p>Rescuers have been seeking unnamed man since pocket of water inundated Rolling Thunder mine on Saturday</p><p>Emergency responders have been trying to reach a miner trapped deep inside a flooded <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/west-virginia">West Virginia</a> coalmine since Saturday, according to authorities.</p><p>A mining crew hit an unknown pocket of water on Saturday about three-quarters of a mile into the Rolling Thunder mine near Drennen, about 50 miles (80km) east of the state capital of Charleston, the Nicholas county commissioner, Garrett Cole, said in a Facebook post.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/11/west-virginia-miner-trapped-search">Continue reading...</a>
